data.task: Fix OpenRouter retry logic so fatal auth errors do not retry and transient errors do.
data.agent_plan_summary: The OpenRouter client's retry logic needs to be updated to distinguish between fatal authentication errors (e.g., 401/403) and transient errors (e.g., 429/5xx), so that only transient errors are retried. Based on the AST and runtime traces, the core logic resides in elephant_coder/openrouter_client.py, specifically in the OpenRouterClient class and its chat_completion method. The fix involves adding error classification logic to check HTTP status codes or error types before deciding to retry.
